page.title: 20A child in Mentmore
page.content: Russell is 11 and lives at Hilltop House on the site of the old allotments. The house is brand new, 6 bedroomed and his dad built it. He's a partner in a building firm. Russell goes to school in Wing but in his free time he rides his bike around the village and makes dens with his friend Jason in the grounds of Mentmore Towers, where they can play freely. He likes living here because it's nice and quiet - "It's louder in the house than outside." Russell has lived in Mentmore for 9 months. He says he'd like to inherit the house eventually! All contributions to this part of the Domesday Survey were made by Tamsin Lane, Susette Lane, Pat Knight, Fiona and Charlie Chambers, Iris Ayris, Toni Evans, Aileen Broad, Jenny Smith, Cherry Else, Betty Hurley and Lesley Inchley.
